args:
On their journey, Alberius and the others visit a
village where dragons and humans live in
harmony. But when it is attacked by the Empire
and the guardian dragon killed, Alberius
resolves to fight and build a place just as
perfect as the fallen village.
Here at last. Let's weigh anchor\nfor the night, shall we?
Er, you mean in this village? But why?
Oh, I heard a rumor or two and wanted\nto drop by. See, some say itâ€”
Greetings, travelers. It is unusual indeed\nfor new faces to visit our humble home.
That's right. People and dragons live\nside-by-side in this place, and it has\nprospered greatly as a result.
I've never heard of such a thing...
Look, O guardian dragon!\nOur wheat has ripened!
Indeed it has, which means it will be time\nto pull the harvest equipment before long.\nOh, I can hardly wait to get started!
Is something amiss, Alberius?\nYou appear distracted.
I was just thinking about how wide the\nworld of this village is.
I'm afraid I don't take your meaning.
In the world we know, people are people,\ndragons are dragons, and ne'er the twain\nshall meet, for lack of a better phrase.
But this village has gone beyond that\nframeworkâ€”so even though it's small,\nit's a wider world than the one outside it.
One day, I'd like to see just how wide\nthe whole world actually is.
Heh. Midgardsormr says the same of me\non an almost daily basis.
I understand. Our world is full of walls\nof one kind of another, and they've\nalways made me feel rather cramped.

The war brings its share, of course,
but even the present internal structure
of the Ilian Church is fraught with the
powerful scheming toward self-interest.
This despite the fact the Ilian creed is \nmodesty itself: Respect dragons and live\nin harmony with all nature.
If only the faith could be more like you\nand think in a positive way about a future\nthat involved dragons. Perhaps then, we...
Ah, apologies. Please pay me no mind;\nI merely pray to the Goddess that your\ndream might one day be realized.

To think I would have an audience with
the Windwyrm all the way out here!
I did not think you ventured beyond
the bounds of your domain.
I encountered an unusual human and was\ncurious as to what he might accomplish,\nso I ventured forth to see it for myself.
Then I hope your journey is a fruitful one.
As do I. Incidentally, might I attribute the\ngreat agricultural abundance here to an\nexercise of your own power?
You see much, Windwyrm. I am indeed\nlending the village my aid to ensure a\nharvest of plenty.
I confess myself unimpressed; one might\nsay you are twisting the ways of the world\nfor the convenience of these people, no?
Is it not the way of the world to bestow\nour blessings upon the people?

There is truth to thatâ€”however, humans
must also fear and respect our might.
Should the balance of this tilt too far,
the order of things would crumble.
Perhaps, but when I think of all the good\npeople here, I find myself loathe to make\nsuch harsh decisions.

Which is the very reason you should
refrain from consorting with people.
How else will you hope to preserve
the way of things?

Your thinking is reasonable, Windwyrmâ€”
but if that is indeed the way of things,
then why are we dragons possessed of
sentiment at all?
If your way is all there was,\nemotions would be unnecessary.

Yet we are emotional beings who are
able to sympathize with people!
When they are happy, we rejoice.
When they are sad, we mourn.
If we dragons are part of the way this\nworld works, then my feelings in this\nrespect must also be a part of it.
I worry you are twisting my words\nmerely to justify your own actions.
Heh. Perhaps I am, at that.\nEven so, I... Hmm?

I finished scouting the village, sir, and
it's barely a speck on the mapâ€”can't be
more than a couple hundred souls there.
But there's also the matter of...
The dragon, yesâ€”which is exactly why\nit cannot stand. We cannot allow humans\nto live as slaves to such a vile creature.
You will find no slaves here.
And you are men of the Dyrenell Empire.\nThis is a small village, with neither the\npower nor the will to rise against you.
There can be no profit in laying siege to this\nplace, so I bid you withdraw your forces\nand leave us in peace.
I refuse; we must expose the deceit\nof this world, and this village is the\nvery epitome of it.
Dragons hold sway over people's lives,\nyet people make not even the slightest\neffort to realize this simple truth.
But the Dyrenell Empire has risen up\nin order to rectify this deception!
Prostrate yourself before our lord, dragon!\nFall down before the true and just savior\nof our world, the great Morsayati!
Blast! Does the power of the Other\nflow inside of this fiend?!
*pant* *pant* What's happening?!\nThis forest was nothing like this\nwhen we first came upon it!
That roar sounded like a fiend.\nI think it came from that way!
Are you all right?! Speak to me!
The Empire is headed to the village...\nand I lack the strength to stop them.
If not the village, at least...\nsave the people...
Worry not; if we combine our power,\nthe Empire will be no trouble and we\ncan save everyone together.
Alas, the time has come for this dragon to\nreturn to the mana from whence he came.
But what of the village you built?!\nWhat of your great society?!

Heh... This is not an end. If other dragons
come to know the joy I had for myself,
we shall become beloved neighbors
with our fellow people.
If you would grace me with mourning\nmy passing, then I would bid you share\nthis message with my dragon brethren:
Live together with people.\nKnow such happiness for yourself.
With the loss of the guardian's blessing,\nfoul mana pollutes the land...
This quickly?!\nIs this the Other's power?
This beautiful, abundant land was created\nby people and a dragon together...
And now it will be laid to ruin\nin an eyeblink.
We can't let the guardian dragon's wishes\namount to nothing. Come on!
Slaughter them! Leave no breath\nin any of their subjugate lungs!
How could you do something so unjust?!\nWhat manner of cowards are you?!
Who are you to question Dyrenell?!
These people merely wanted to live in\npeace! What possible reason could you\nhave for attacking their village?!
There are undeniable barriers between our\nraces and the dragons, and we of Dyrenell\nwill see such divisions ground to dust.
But these people had already cleared away\nsuch barriers! They lived together with a\ndragon in a state of perfect harmony!
What was this place, if not the very\nembodiment of your dream?!
That cooperation was but a deception.\nWhy do you not realize that dragons\nmerely look down upon us?!
The people here accepted the dragon's\ncontrol, and with it a life of indolence.\nTHAT was their crime!
His Grace the Emperor has tasked us to\nopen the world's eyes, and we will\nshow them the justice of the Other!
And what kind of justice takes peaceful\nlives and tramples them underfoot?
The dragon trampled upon them long\nbefore we did, and we will liberate this\nworld that is rife with their deception!
I understand now: Your ï¼‚justiceï¼‚ gives you\nthe right to crush others because you were\nwronged yourselves.
I know what it means to have it,\nand I am prepared.
If this tragedy is the foul future the\nDyrenell Empire seeks to bring about,\nthen I will stand against them!
I will take the sacred sword in hand\nand wear the heavy crown of a hero!
Come then, Dyrenell. This is the day the\nlegend of the dragonblood hero begins!
